title: Check timelines
content_markdown:
Version: 8.3All Creatio products
On this page
Use the timeline to get chronological insights into your record history. The timeline provides quick access to information about tasks, communications, additional materials, and other linked Creatio objects in a single stream, giving you a comprehensive view of all interactions related to a record (Fig. 1). You can also open call and chat pages directly from timeline records with a single click.
The timeline is available out of the box in various sections including **Accounts** , **Contacts** , **Leads** , **Opportunities** , **Invoices** , **Orders** , and other sections throughout Creatio.
The timeline can be located in other customized Creatio sections as well.
Fig. 1 Timeline tab in Freedom UI
![Fig. 1 Timeline tab in Freedom UI](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/images/Platform_basics/work_with_timelines/scr_timeline_contact_timeline.png)
Timeline records that have extensive content might appear in a collapsed view, such as **Emails** , **Calls** and **Chats**. Click **Details** to expand these records or open their pages.
The timeline displays linked records in chronological order. The following types of records appear in the timeline:
* Tasks
* Calls
* Emails
* Feed messages
* Files
* Links
* Contracts
* Documents
* Projects
In some sections, the timeline displays additional record types based on product and section specifics. For example, in banking products, you might see customer cases, invoices, and cards in the timeline.
You can sort records chronologically by clicking ![](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/images/Platform_basics/work_with_timelines/btn_sort_by_date_asc.png) to sort records in ascending order (oldest first) or ![](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/images/Platform_basics/work_with_timelines/btn_sort_by_date_desc.png) to sort records in descending order (newest first).
## Work with timelines​
### Edit feed messages​
You can edit your feed messages directly from the timeline without navigating to the main feed component (Fig. 2). To edit a feed message:
1. **Hover** over the feed message tile in the timeline.
2. **Click** the **Actions** button (three dots) that appears.
3. **Select** **Edit** from the menu.
4. **Make** your changes and save.
**As a result** , the edited message updates immediately in the timeline, providing a seamless editing experience.
Fig. 2 Editing feed messages in timeline
![Fig. 2 Editing feed messages in timeline](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/images/Platform_basics/work_with_timelines/scr_update_feed_msg_in_timeline.gif)
### Filter records by type​
By default, Creatio displays all record types available for the page. To **filter records by type** (Fig. 2):
1. **Click** the filter button ![](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/images/Platform_basics/work_with_timelines/btn_filter_timeline.png) in the timeline control panel.
2. **Select** which record types you want to display in the timeline.
**As a result** , Creatio will only show records of the selected types, making it easier to focus on specific information.
Fig. 2 Filtering timeline by record type
![Fig. 2 Filtering timeline by record type](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/images/Platform_basics/work_with_timelines/scr_filter_timeline_by_object_type.gif)
### Filter records by time period​
To narrow down the timeline to a specific time period (Fig. 3):
1. **Click** the calendar button ![](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/images/Platform_basics/work_with_timelines/btn_select_period.png) in the timeline control panel.
2. **Choose** one of the predefined periods (Last Week, Next Month, etc.) or specify a custom period.
**As a result** , the timeline will display only the records that fall within your selected time period.
Fig. 3 Filtering timeline by period
![Fig. 3 Filtering timeline by period](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/images/Platform_basics/work_with_timelines/scr_filter_timeline_by_period.gif)
### Filter records by owner​
To view records owned by specific users (Fig. 4):
1. **Click** the user filter button ![](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/images/Platform_basics/work_with_timelines/btn_select_owner.png) in the timeline control panel.
2. **Select** the user whose records you want to display.
**As a result** , the timeline will show only records owned by the selected user, helping you focus on specific user's activities.
Fig. 4 Filtering timeline by owner
![Fig. 4 Filtering timeline by owner](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/images/Platform_basics/work_with_timelines/scr_filter_by_owner.gif)
### Hide system messages​
Check the **Hide system messages** checkbox in the timeline control panel (Fig. 5) to focus on user-created content. This feature hides system messages from the timeline, giving you a cleaner view with only user interactions.
Fig. 5 Hide system messages
![Fig. 5 Hide system messages](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/images/Platform_basics/work_with_timelines/scr_timeline_hide_system_messages.png)
### Search in timeline​
To quickly locate specific information within the timeline (Fig. 6):
1. **Click** the search button ![](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/images/Platform_basics/work_with_timelines/btn_search.png) in the timeline control panel.
2. **Enter** keywords or phrases relevant to the content you're looking for.
**As a result** , you can quickly find specific information without scrolling through the entire timeline. Search results reset when you refresh or close the page.
Fig. 6 Searching in timeline
![Fig. 6 Searching in timeline](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/images/Platform_basics/work_with_timelines/scr_timeline_search_timeline.png)
### Sort in chronological order​
To sort records chronologically (Fig. 7):
* Click ![](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/images/Platform_basics/work_with_timelines/btn_sort_by_date_asc.png) to sort records in ascending order (oldest first).
* Click ![](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/images/Platform_basics/work_with_timelines/btn_sort_by_date_desc.png) to sort records in descending order (newest first).
Fig. 7 Changing chronological order
![Fig. 7 Changing chronological order](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/images/Platform_basics/work_with_timelines/scr_change_chronological_order.gif)
* * *
